conclusion: Determine both the average velocity and the average speed of the particle as it moves from point A to point C along the given path.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius R = 1 meter.
The circumference of a full circle is given by 2πR.
The length of one semi-circular arc is πR.
Displacement is the straight-line distance between the initial point (A) and the final point (C).
Points A and C are directly opposite each other across the diameter of the two semi-circles.
The diameter of each semi-circle is 2R.
Average speed is the total distance traveled divided by the total time taken.
Average velocity is the displacement divided by the total time taken.
The average velocity of the particle is 0.8 m/s and the average speed of the particle is 2π/5 m/s.
